SENT.plain: We have described a patient with neurogenic hyperthermia caused by a diencephalic infarction
His hypothalamic dysfunction was a consequence of cerebral vasospasm from aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage

Persistent elevation of body temperature did not respond to standard therapy, but successful treatment was achieved with cyproheptadine and indomethacin, presumably through antagonism of serotonin and prostaglandin activity
